oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harper's Weekly Oct. 12, 1861
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Harper's Weekly was among the most popular publications in the North during the Civil War and was heavily illustrated. Inside is a large woodcut depicting the important generals of the Union army. Prominent in the center is General Winfield Scott. Not listed in 1861 was U.S. Grant who rises to fame later. Also depicted in this edition was the Battle of Lexington, Missouri fought September 12-20, 1861 between the Union Army and and the pro-Confederate Missouri State Guard. The State Guard won.
